bibl.title: Urban Centers and Rural Contexts in Late Antiquity
bibl.note: A stable relationship grew out of a two-way flow of goods, services, taxes, and people between the city of Alexandria and its immediate hinterland surrounding Lake Mareotis. By the time the lake was dealt a final death blow when the Canopic branch of the Nile dried up, both ends of this great city / hinterland system had turned away from the other and had learned to rely instead on their own resources.
HAAS Christopher, Alexandria and the Mareotis Region.
Thomas S. BURNS and John W. EADIE (Edd.), Urban Centers and Rural Contexts in Late Antiquity (East Lansing, Mich., 2001) pp. 47-62, 1 fig.
